Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Protonectin (Leu-rich; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA; BBMm)
Sequence Information.Source: venom, social wasp,Protonectarina sylveirae; Agelaia pallipes pallipes; Parachartergus fraternus
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: Helical conformation is critical for peptide activity (Wang K et al, 2013.).

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 20-64 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 1 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 8 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 4 uM), and S. aureus (MIC 8-10 uM) (ref. see AP1640).Toxicity: Protonectin is a non-hemo.lytic chemotactic peptide for polymorphonucleated leukocytes (PMNL), presenting some mast cell degranulating activity.Discovery: This peptide is found in multiple species.MOA:bacteria:E. coli: acted on bacterial memrbanes.Structure: random coil in PBS and helical in 50% TFE.Entry history: The original Dhvar4 has been replaced 9/30/10. Updated 7/2013; 3/2019; 7/2021.
Literature Information.Author: Mendes MA, de Souza BM, Marques MR, Palma MS.2004
Literature Information.Title: Structural and biological characterization of two novel peptides from the venom of the neotropical social wasp Agelaia pallipes pallipes
